sentence: typically, antidumping duties are levied when foreign average prices are below the average cost of production.
but that also describes a practice that often emerges as a wholly appropriate response to a softening in demand.
it is the rare case that prices fall below marginal cost, which would be a more relevant standard.
the reason should be that it enhances standards of living through the effects of competition on productivity.
it is difficult to find credible evidence that trade has affected the level of total employment in this country over the long run.
indeed, in recent months we have experienced the widest trade deficit in history with unemployment still close to record lows.
the relative balance of supply and demand in a competitive market economy determines the mix of employment.
when exports fall or imports rise, domestic demand and relative prices have invariably adjusted in the long run to leave total employment generally unaffected.

if we freeze competitive progress in place, we will almost certainly slow economic growth overall and impart substantial harm to those workers who would otherwise seek more-effective longer-term job opportunities.
